intro: Uncinia phalaroides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, linear leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Uncinia phalaroides is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
